result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Duplicate copies of T.A.W.'s mental health records shall be destroyed by a staff memeber of Milwaukee County DA's Office.  The Clerk of Courts office shall preserve a sealed copy.  Parties are not to discuss the contents of said mental health records with any third party not associated with this case.

Defendant Charles Edward Bell in court with attorney Richard L. Voss.  Defendant Charles Edward Bell in custody.  Michael Thurston appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Pursuant to plea negotiations and on motion of the State, Court ordered counts 1 and 2 dismissed and read-in.

of Assistant District Attorney Michael Thurston and Motion to have T.A.W's Medical Records returned and Sealed Before the Coming of Findings Articulated on the Record Authorizing Release and unitl T.A.W. has an Opportunity to Exercise her righ to Non-Disclosure.

Case calendared for status on medical records and this was held in chambers. There is no other court date scheduled and clerk has contacted parties to schedule a new court date.

Court grants defense request for release of medical records, mental health records from BHD (state to arrange), cooperation from mother (state to arrange), court will examine all BHD records and determine which ones will be released if any to defense.

Defendant Charles Edward Bell in court with attorney Alejandro A. Lockwood.  Defendant Charles Edward Bell in custody.  Michael Thurston appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Motion hearing proceeded. Additional arguements heard. As to the State's joinder motion, Court granted the State's motion and ordered this case joined with case #15CF1451. Parties to file motions by 06/12/2015. State to file proposed verdict forms and substantive jury instructions by the final pretrial date. Defendant Charles Edward Bell in court with attorney Alejandro A. Lockwood.  Defendant Charles Edward Bell in custody.  Cynthia Davis for Michael Thurston appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the state:Eric Sturino-West Allis Police Department Detective.   State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and pleads not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 25.  Scheduling conference scheduled for April 23, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for Electronic Monitoring and Supervision.  ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY to be monitored by drug testing and portable breathalyzers.  Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.  Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with TAW dob 10/4/02, her mother, Sonja W. dob 12/7/1983 or a witness who TAW initiall disclosed this incident to KML dob 9/24/95
